page.title: 18THE RIVER SEVERN
page.content: The{River Severn}here is more navigable than previously with the building of a weir at Maisemore. {Healing's Mill at Tewkesbury}still use three grain barges connecting with{Sharpness.}Also it is used by many{Angling Clubs}e.g. BAA.,Windmill. Each year they are given a different stretch of water. The most popular fish are Bleak, Roach and Eels. {The Avon Sailing Club}is based at{Chaceley Stock.}It was built in 196O. Jo Richards, the{Olympic {bronze medalist,}started sailing at the Club. Every Winter as the River Severn rises it causes flooding in and around Deerhurst and Apperley. It sometimes freezes over making the situation worse. Some families can be surrounded by the water,only escaping by boat.
